programmes.show_description: Arthur gets into the car phone business not realising he is dealing with a dodgy supplier, and Terry fancies a girl who tries to hide her family background. S6 E2: Life in the Fast Food Lane
Alf tries to organise a street party in celebration of a royal wedding - unfortunately, nobody else seems interested. S5 E2: The Royal Wedding
The youngsters want a party, but George - recalling the last one - is against the idea. Mildred, however, is all for it and gives it her blessing... S6 E1: The Party's Over
David and Amy Pearce arrive in Spain for their 'second honeymoon' using David's redundancy pay. S1 E1: Viva Espana
Ozzy becomes addicted to burritos while he and Sharon are disgusted at Jack and Kelly's late-night partying. S2 E5: Smells Like Teen Spirits
Hit 70s sitcom starring Jimmy Jewel and Hylda Baker as brother and sister Eli and Nellie Pledge, forced to run a family pickle factory together in Lancashire. S4, E3: When You've Got To Go
Hit 70s sitcom starring Jimmy Jewel and Hylda Baker as brother and sister Eli and Nellie Pledge, forced to run a family pickle factory together in Lancashire. S4, E4: When Love Walks In
We look at the now-preserved Severn Valley line from Kidderminster to Bewdley and explain why these long-closed railways are still remembered with such affection by those who travelled on them.
The home of a great night's sleep. Every body. Every bedroom. Every budget. Teleshopping.
Holiday inspiration. Discover the perfect holiday for you, featuring the hottest destinations and exclusive deals to make your next holiday the best one. Teleshopping.
Make perfect toasties right in your microwave - that's right! Clever Micro Toastie is microwave cooking with a crunch! Order now at www.highstreettv.com. Teleshopping.
Holiday inspiration. Discover the perfect holiday for you, featuring the hottest destinations and exclusive deals to make your next holiday the best one. Teleshopping.
Classic comedy sketch show starring Dick Emery and featuring June Whitfield and Pat Coombs. S10 E1: Matrimonial Stakes
With Sid James and Robin Askwith. Tensions arise when the Baines family moves next door to the Abbots and clash over a home distillery and unruly teens during attempts at mediation. Comedy 1972 (U)
Rigsby is looking for another lodger - one of his current lodgers, Miss Jones, is keen for her acquaintance Philip to move in because she is attracted to him. S1 E1: The New Lodger
Rigsby becomes convinced that magic is real after Philip bangs a ritual spear on the floor - while Ruth tries to offer herself to Rigsby, Philip and Alan play a trick on him. S1 E2: Black Magic
Rigsby is dressed to kill as he takes Miss Jones out to dinner to celebrate her birthday. S1 E3: A Night Out
Rigsby is given some advice from Alan and Philip - as well as some tablets - to calm his nerves in his amorous pursuit of Miss Jones. S1 E4: Charisma
Mr Spooner annoys the household by playing his radio loudly - Rigsby is annoyed, but he finds it difficult to pluck up the courage to confront him about it. S1 E5: All Our Yesterdays
When Miss Jones sees a prowler through her window, Rigsby suspects everyone else as a police detective appears and begins to investigate. S1 E6: The Prowler
An election polarises the household - Rigsby supports the Conservatives, Alan and Philip lean towards Labour, and Miss Jones is impressed with the Liberal candidate. S1 E7: Stand Up and Be Counted
When Ruth is depressed following the 'deception' of a recent male friend, Rigsby takes what he believes to be his chance to woo her. S2 E1: The Permissive Society

Miss Jones is collecting for a famine charity when Philip challenges Rigsby to go 48 hours without eating - Rigsby gladly accepts the offer but soon finds his will weakening. S2 E2: Food Glorious Food
Health and fitness are the new buzzwords in the house when Rigsby's keenness to portray himself in prime condition leads him to challenge Philip to a boxing match. S2 E3: A Body Like Mine

The vicar calls asking for an article on rag-and-bone men for the church magazine's centenary edition; Harold writes the article but Albert makes the contribution of a crossword. S7 E1: Men of Letters
Harold joins the local amateur dramatic society; when rehearsals take place at the yard, Albert thinks he will give the acting lark a go as well. S7 E2: A Star Is Born
Albert receives news that his brother has died; a family funeral is held and the deceased Steptoe has the last laugh when his will is read out. S7 E3: Oh, What a Beautiful Mourning
Drastic action is needed when Albert gets a visit from the Inland Revenue investigating his claim for his wife who has been dead for 30 years. S7 E4: Live Now, P.A.Y.E. Later
Harold tries to kill Albert while sleepwalking, leading to a visit to a psychiatrist triggering memories of when Albert scared away Harold's girlfriend. Featuring Joanna Lumley. S7 E5: Loathe Story
Classic comedy with the rag-and-bone team. When the arguments become just too much for Harold, he decides to take drastic measures to get some peace from Albert. S7 E6: Divided We Stand

There's no electricity, no gas, no food, no booze and no fags. On top of that, two unwelcome visitors drop by - and they seem strangely familiar. Featuring Leonard Rossiter. S7 E7: The Desperate Hours
Arthur hires failed safe-cracker Scotch Harry for a job - and finds himself with a bandaged fugitive on his hands. S6 E3: Return of the Invincible Man
New manageress Joyce organises a dance competition, judged by her old flame Cyril. Janice ends up dancing with an old admirer of hers, and Kenneth hires a Spanish assistant for his hair salon. S5 E2
Learning of the death of his ex-cellmates is sending Paddy round the bend. Three of them have been taken out in suspicious circumstances: could this mean he's next?. S4 E8
When Mildred is going to the Floral Society annual dinner dance but George doesn't want to, Robin agrees to accompany Mildred to the dance and leaves George rather jealous. S6 E3: The Generation Game
New manageress Joyce organises a dance competition, judged by her old flame Cyril. Janice ends up dancing with an old admirer of hers, and Kenneth hires a Spanish assistant for his hair salon. S5 E2
Arthur hires failed safe-cracker Scotch Harry for a job - and finds himself with a bandaged fugitive on his hands. S6 E3: Return of the Invincible Man
The Garnetts' game of Monopoly is disrupted by a blackout. S5 E3: Strikes and Blackouts
When the lease is up on the flat and George wants to increase the rent, the flatmates decide that the only way to raise the money is to get a fourth tenant to share. S6 E2: One More for the Pot
The two couples go to see a bullfight to see El Macho in action - David is fascinated, but the fight doesn't live up to his expectations. S1 E2: El Macho
Kelly gets her friend Sarah to be the drummer of her band, Jason Dill comes back to stay, and new dog Arthur encroaches upon Gus the cat. S2 E6: Meow Means No
A selection of live performances from TV music shows in the 1960s for a genuine taste of the best of the '60s!
Hit 70s sitcom starring Jimmy Jewel and Hylda Baker as brother and sister Eli and Nellie Pledge, forced to run a family pickle factory together in Lancashire. S4, E5: An Open-And-Shut Case
Hit '70s sitcom starring Jimmy Jewel and Hylda Baker as brother and sister Eli and Nellie Pledge, who are forced to run a family pickle factory together in Lancashire. S5, E1: Make Yourself at Home
Branch lines and secondary routes have always had a special appeal; this programme recalls many such English byways in films made in the 1950s and the 1960s.

A selection of live performances from TV music shows in the 1960s for a genuine taste of the best of the '60s!
Stan's job is made more difficult when Olive becomes a clippie aboard his bus. S1 E3: Olive Takes a Trip
Stan's stomach pains are 'an occupational hazard' from sitting over a vibrating engine all day according to him, but Arthur has other ideas. S1 E4: Bus Drivers' Stomach
When Miss Jones becomes engaged to a librarian and looks set to move out, Rigsby is distraught but is determined that no other man should have her. S2 E4: Moonlight and Roses
Rigsby has found a new lodger called Seymour who is staying in town away from his country estate, but Philip and Alan aren't quite as convinced of his authenticity. S2 E5: A Perfect Gentleman
Rigsby is hoping to take new tenant Brenda out for the evening, but he has a cashflow problem and a string of unwelcome visitors who start arriving at the house. S2 E6: Last of the Big Spenders
Could rumours of the Grey Lady who haunts the house be true? Rigsby certainly believes so, but he has not seen her yet... S2 E7: Things That Go Bump In The Night
Classic sitcom about a miserly landlord. Rigsby faces the prospect of a lonely Christmas until Alan and Philip arrive unexpectedly. S2 E8: For the Man Who Has Everything (Christmas Special 1975)
Rigsby returns from a Spanish holiday to find Alan has let out the two spare rooms; he's happy Miss Jones has returned but less enthusiastic about a single mother and her baby. S3 E1: That's My Boy
A photographer arrives at the yard and wants to use it for a fashion shoot, but there's a surprising volunteer when a male model is required. S8 E1: Back in Fashion
Harold's love life has collapsed and so has his bed - however, he discovers after splashing out on a waterbed that it's not the only time he will be splashing. S8 E2: And So to Bed
Harold brings home an old 'What the Butler Saw' machine but gets a surprise when he takes a look at the film inside; what will the vicar think at the church fete? S8 E3: Porn Yesterday
Local villain Frankie Barrow demands money with menaces from the Steptoes, so Albert hatches a scheme with the help of Shepherd Bush's answer to the Seven Samurai. S8 E4: The Seven Steptoerai
Albert has done his back in and runs Harold ragged with demands for help; after a bit of detective work, Harold deduces all is not quite as it seems. S8 E5: Upstairs, Downstairs, Upstairs, Downstairs
Clairvoyant Madame Fontana is invited to hold a seance at the Steptoes by Albert as he wants to get in touch with Harold's mother. S8 E6: Seance In a Wet Rag and Bone Yard
Fletch is released from prison - will he be able to stop himself from going back? First he has to say goodbye to Mr MacKay, the prison officer who has been the bane of his life. S1 E1: Going Home

Fletch's probation officer is disappointed that he hasn't found a job as Fletch plans to dig up some loot he buried in Essex before he went to prison, but there's a problem. S1 E2: Going To Be Alright
Fletch takes pity on a young runaway pickpocket named Penny and takes her home for a bath and a meal - she betrays his kindness and Fletch feels let down. S1 E3: Going Sour
Fletch's probation officer gets him a job as a night porter, but his return to work is not smooth sailing. S1 E4: Going to Work
Now working as a hotel porter, Fletch recognises unscrupulous guest Worm Wellings and suspects that he may be planning an insurance scam. S1 E5: Going Going Gone
Fletch feels frustrated that his ex-wife's partner is paying for his daughter's wedding, so he is tempted when someone offers to pay him to be a lookout for a burglary. S1 E6: Going Off The Rails
Faced with a huge tax bill, Arthur fakes his own death and hides - but Chisholm is suspicious. S6 E4: Arthur is Dead, Long Live Arthur

Mick's brother and dad appear in Benidorm, for a messy stag party. Mick isn't happy about this, or about bringing Michael and Donald along for the ride. Gavin, meanwhile, gets an upsetting text. S5 E3
A drunken night out turns into a nightmare for Frank when he mistakes an electrical generator for a urinal. Hospital tests reveal that he has a heart condition and may not last to the weekend. S5 E1
George needs some money and so sells Mildred's sun lamp to Larry; later, when Mildred is upstairs, she sees her lamp and thinks that Robin has stolen it. S6 E4: The Sunshine Boys
Rigsby is looking for another lodger - one of his current lodgers, Miss Jones, is keen for her acquaintance Philip to move in because she is attracted to him. S1 E1: The New Lodger
